If the transduction was aborted, perhaps the cell doesn't have access to the necessary genes for producing other sugars like lactose. So, in a medium with only galactose, the cell would try to convert it into glucose via gluconeogenesis. But since the cell has no other sugars to use for energy (assuming it's a gal^+ cell), it would go into glycolysis.
